
A rushed engineer used RSA, but both primes are Blum integers. Can you decrypt the secret message: 7537071769164767205907486743831336437341146292093824319846722376763491806434239267406448890469182687787155991414363053327481420820070065969668228850837836?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=9313029764967571067993162441970926591335818274565371005348591955573146725676991623543686010685215523477754312709705021564614495724402443714345451104400517, e=8165755020319221400774655904137665164135635013360503811277440630047387178527057826375442888217441749807806350658655360057862165899408990823301280296617921
The lower 104 bits of p are: 4879492085596957357805653671449618159


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{wuwgfhy2}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 7537071769164767205907486743831336437341146292093824319846722376763491806434239267406448890469182687787155991414363053327481420820070065969668228850837836
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9313029764967571067993162441970926591335818274565371005348591955573146725676991623543686010685215523477754312709705021564614495724402443714345451104400517, e=8165755020319221400774655904137665164135635013360503811277440630047387178527057826375442888217441749807806350658655360057862165899408990823301280296617921
